verses.text: 表明是　神的僕人我們這些與　神同工的，也勸你們不要白受　神的恩典。

words.note: Capitalized in Bible text for reverence.
Capitalized in Bible text for reverence.
Refers to spiritual co-laborers in the Bible.
Means to receive something without benefit or appreciation.
Capitalized in Bible text for reverence.
Often refers to God's unmerited favor.

verses.text: 因為他說：「在悅納的時候，我應允了你；在拯救的日子，我幫助了你。」看哪！現在就是悅納的時候，現在就是拯救的日子。

words.note: Refers to a time or offering that is pleasing to God.
Often used for God answering prayers or promises.
Refers to deliverance, especially spiritual salvation.
An exclamation drawing attention to what follows.
Refers to a time or offering that is pleasing to God.
Refers to deliverance, especially spiritual salvation.

verses.text: 我們凡事都沒有妨礙人，不讓這職分受到毀謗，

words.note: Refers to a sacred office or calling.

verses.text: 反而在各樣的事上，表明自己是　神的僕人，就如持久的忍耐、患難、貧乏、困苦、

words.note: Used with '在...事' to indicate 'in matters of'.
Capitalized in Bible text for reverence.

verses.text: 鞭打、監禁、擾亂、勞苦、不睡覺、禁食、

words.note: A verb-object compound functioning as a noun here.

verses.text: 純潔、知識、容忍、恩慈、聖靈、無偽的愛心、
真理的道、　神的大能等事上；並且是藉著左右兩手中公義的武器，

words.note: Often preceded by a space in Chinese Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 藉著榮耀和羞辱、壞名聲和好名譽。我們好像是騙人的，卻是真誠的，
好像是人所不知的，卻是人所共知的；好像是必死的，你看，我們卻是活著的；好像是受懲罰的，卻沒有處死；
好像憂愁，卻是常常喜樂的；好像貧窮，卻使很多人富足；好像是甚麼都沒有，卻是樣樣都有。
哥林多人哪！我們對你們，口是坦率的，心是寬宏的。
並不是我們對你們器量小，而是你們自己心胸狹窄。
你們也要照樣以寬宏的心對待我們，這話正像是我對兒女說的。
分別為聖你們和不信的人不可共負一軛，義和不法有甚麼相同呢？光明和黑暗怎能相通呢？

words.note: A key biblical concept of being set apart for God's purposes.
Refers to those who do not believe in God/Christ.
Symbolizes bondage, labor, or unequal partnership.
In a theological sense, right standing before God.
Often refers to breaking divine law or moral principles.

words.definition: how can, how is it possible

verses.text: 基督和彼列（「彼列」是撒但的別名）怎能和諧呢？信的和不信的有甚麼聯繫呢？

words.note: A name for Satan or a wicked spirit.

words.definition: how can, how is it possible

words.note: Refers to those who do not believe in God/Christ.

verses.text: 神的殿和偶像怎能協調呢？我們就是永生　神的殿，正如　神說：「我要住在他們中間，在他們中間來往；我要作他們的　神，他們要作我的子民。」

words.note: Refers to a sacred dwelling place.
Here describes God as 'living eternally'.
The preceding space is a typesetting convention for reverence.
The preceding space is a typesetting convention for reverence.
Biblically implies divine presence and interaction.
The preceding space is a typesetting convention for reverence.

verses.text: 所以，「主說：你們要從他們中間出來，和他們分開，不可觸摸不潔淨的東西，我就收納你們。」

words.note: Connects adjective to an implied noun (thing).
Common word for 'thing'.

verses.text: 「我要作你們的父親，你們要作我的兒女。這是全能的主說的。」

words.note: Emphasizes the preceding phrase, often implying 'it is...who'.
Forms a '是...的' structure to emphasize the agent or manner.
